title: Sierra Space prepares to ship Dream Chaser to Florida
summary: Sierra Space says it has wrapped up a series of environmental tests of its Dream Chaser cargo spaceplane at a NASA facility in Ohio and is ready to ship the spacecraft to Florida for a launch later this year.

title: China launches its first medium Earth orbit broadband satellites
summary: China launched the first satellites for a medium Earth orbit broadband constellation late Wednesday.

title: Congressional letter seeks big increase in NASA science budget
summary: More than 40 House members have signed a letter asking for a significant increase in NASA’s science budget for 2025, a request that will be challenging to fulfill given spending caps.

title: Virgin Galactic plans higher mothership flight rate with next-generation spaceplanes
summary: Virgin Galactic says it will fly its existing “mothership” aircraft more frequently than previously planned with its upcoming Delta-class suborbital spaceplanes, allowing the company to defer development of a new plane while also dealing with a legal dispute with Boeing.

title: National Space Council will explore military space and intelligence roles and responsibilities
summary: The council will delve into the ongoing tug-of-war between military and intelligence agency leaders.

title: United Launch Alliance delays the first crewed Boeing Starliner launch
summary: United Launch Alliance has delayed the launch of the first crewed Starliner launch to no earlier than May 17th at 6:16 pm...

title: NRO outlines plan to onboard commercial satellite imaging technologies
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office is considering a more flexible contracting vehicle to work with commercial remote-sensing companies

title: Join SpaceNews: Exciting Opportunity for Sales & Marketing Manager
summary: Are you passionate about space and eager to kick-start your career with a renowned industry leader? SpaceNews, the premier source for space industry news and analysis, is seeking a proactive […]

title: Military surveillance constellation fuels debate over who calls the shots
summary: U.S. Space Force Lt. Gen. David Miller raises questions over the control and employment of Ground Moving Target Indicator satellites.

title: Xona raises $19 million Series A funds for satellite navigation service
summary: The funding round was led by Steve Jurvetson’s Future Ventures and Seraphim Space
